item.title: I Want Functional Scrollbars
item.description: Lately I’ve been lamenting the death of the functional scrollbar. Remember back in the day when scrollbars looked like this? The scrollbars were prominent because they were meant to be used. You were expected to grab one with your mouse and move it up and down. Today, scrollbars have a much different appearance and expectation of functionality. This is what they look like in Firefox on Gnome 43 running under Fedora 37:
